descr: AutoLaTeX is a tool for managing small to large sized LaTeX documents. The user can easily perform all required steps to do such tasks as: preview the document, or produce a PDF file.

Supported Tools.plain:
- latex
- pdflatex
- xelatex
- lualatex
- bibtex
- biber
- makeindex
- makeglossaries
- dvips

Automatic File Convertions to PS/PDF/PNG.plain:
- asta
- dia
- dot
- fig
- ggb
- gxl
- odg
- plot
- svg
- vsd
- xmi

Automatic File Convertions to TeX.plain:
- c/c++
- java
- matlab
- ml
- perl
- python
- ruby
- sql
- Beamer

Editor Plugins.plain:
- Gedit3
- Gtk3
- Sublime Text 3
- Gedit2
- Sublime Text 2
- Gtk2

descr: This script permits centralization of the many program calls necessary to completely compile a LaTeX document.

Supported Tools.plain:
- latex
- pdflatex
- dvips
- ps2pdf
- bibtex
- makeindex

descr: arara is a TeX automation tool based on rules and directives.

descr: Go automates the processing of a LaTeX document, according to a file .gorc in the same directory as the document.
This package provides several tools that aim to simplify the compilation of LaTeX documents.

Supported Tools.plain:
- latex
- pdflatex
- dvips
- ps2pdf
- bibtex
- makeindex

descr: Latexmk completely automates the process of generating a LaTeX document.

Supported Tools.plain:
- latex
- dvips
- dvipdf
- xelatex
- pdflatex
- bibtex
- makeindex

descr: A csh script to run LaTeX as many times as needed (and hopefully no more) on a given file to resolve cross references and to ensure that the table of contents and index (if any) are up-to-date.

Supported Tools.plain:
- pdflatex
- xelatex
- luatex
- bibtex
- biber
- makeindex
- metapost
- sagetex
- tikzext
- gnuplot
- synctex

descr: Make_latex is a library of make(1) rules for producing LaTeX documents: it has rules for running LaTeX 'enough' times, for running BibTeX for various format conversions and for printing final results.
mk is a Bash script that, in close collaboration with vpp (short for View and Print PDF/PostScrit), is helpful in the cyclic process of editing, compiling, viewing, and printing of a LaTeX document.
The package provides a tool that compiles LaTeX-documents as often as needed, including makeindex and BibTeX calls.
Rubber is a program whose purpose is to handle all tasks related to the compilation of LaTeX documents.

Supported Tools.plain:
- pdflatex
- etex
- aleph
- omega
- vtex
- bibtex
- makeindex

descr: A shell script that runs each Texinfo or (La)TeX file in through TeX in turn, until all cross-references are resolved, building all indexes.

Supported Tools.plain:
- latex
- dvips
- dvipdf
- pdflatex
- bibtex
- makeindex
